reviews.text: I stayed at this Hampton Inn while on business. The hotel is your average Hampton Inn, which is to say that it is clean with friendly staff. The hotel seemed as if it had been recently updated which was a nice perk. There are some decent food options close by too.
reviews.title: Nice business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on the last night of our vacation. It was very clean and looked like it might have had recent renovations. Would stay here again while traveling.
reviews.title: Great for a night or two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: absolutely wonderful-fabulous breakfast-clean room and very comfortable sleep. great deal-stay fri and sat night and stay sunday night for free. i would certainly reccommend this to everyone. I can't wait to go back there again!
reviews.title: the best time i ever had

reviews.text: My family and I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn in Danbury, CT. My daughter was in a nearby dance competition so we stayed in Danbury for one night. The Hampton Inn lobby looks newly renovated as do the hallways and our pleasant room. They have an indoor pool for the family and a small but efficient gymnasium. They have free coffee all day and a good variety for breakfast. Tack on the reasonable cost and just off I84 you can't beat it. If you are in the area stay here for sure.
reviews.title: Economical & A Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bit on the dated side, but clean. The hotel is a bit buried off the road, but in it's prime ten years ago, it was probably tops... now, not so much. The rooms are clean and functional, but do not expect much more. The bathroom was smaller than my walk-in closet. I do give props for a potentially good breakfast bar, sans twenty screaming kids touching everything. With that all said, it is worth the stay considering other area options.
reviews.title: It was... Average

reviews.text: Easy access to I-84, and convenient to local restaurants. This Hampton Inn is always quiet, and is set back from the highway. The staff is always willing to help out, and fun to chat with. The interior was remodeled a few years ago, so is updated nicely. Great hotel with room to spread out for small meetings. Check out the lounge area on the basement level. Larger excercise room than most Hamptons, and great pool! Staff is cool, doesn't sweat the small stuff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: I've stayed in several Hampton Inn's over the past few years. It's a nice chain and they are consistently good. This one did not disappoint. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the Internet was free--as it should be.
reviews.title: Nice, comfortable hotel.

reviews.text: The free breakfast was okay. A step up from continental, but not made to order.
reviews.title: perfect choice

reviews.text: Overall, a good, basic higher-end place to stay.
reviews.title: Management Cares!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean, easy to find, great pool area, snacks available in lobby, free hot breakfast,and restaurants in walking distance. When traveling, I will always check out Hampton Inn hotels first.
reviews.title: We loved this hotel

reviews.text: Being a Holiday Inn Express customer we are used to a decent hotel and was not expecting much when we checked in here, but it's great to be pleasantly surprised. The bed is comfy and the duvet covers are changed after each guest assuring cleanliness. Clean and well maintained all around no complaints at all. Pool was larger than expected after seeing the pictures online although not big it's good. Hot tub was clean and hot, the front desk staff was polite for the most part and accommodating even supplying forgotten items such as toothbrush, razor, shower cap. There's always complimentary apples and fresh brewed coffee, choice of teas, real cream etc. The breakfast was quite good the first day, waffles, breads, muffins, eggs, sausage patties, yogurt, fresh fruit salad, bananas etc. The next day there was ham circles not as good and sausage links ditto, but still good free breakfast and very good coffee. The restaurants are indeed within walking distance, Friendly's in the parking lot and Chili's, walk to Walmart, Marshall's, liquor store, Dunkin Donut, Taco Bell. We were surprised that on Sunday night we couldn't find a beer in the state of Connecticut no alcohol sold, not sure about the laws but check on that if you find yourself without wine etc. Plenty of parking in the back also so don't limit yourself to the front, the handicapped parking is around back and real close to lobby. Only thing is I wish they would give you more than one roll of toilet paper at a time....hey the little things....
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!!!!
Great staff clean property
reviews.text: This hotel is very well kept and clean. The staff was very helpful. I wish the window opened for fresh air.
Breakfast was a bit weak. Overall a great place.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel during our travels through the Northeast. Wonderful hotel. Would stay there again without hesitation. The breakfast was out of this world!
reviews.title: Lodging enroute Boston to NYC weeknight

reviews.text: On a recent trip from Boston to NYC stayed at this hotel on weeknight. Room was very clean and bed very comfortable. Staff was very nice at 9pm and 6am. The location is about 10 minutues off the highway in a very quiet area, hotel sits back off the road. Restaurants in walking distances. This is the perfect over night lodging enroute from Boston to NYC. Leaving at 6am the next morning I was on the lower west side at 7:30am. Looks like the hotel was recently updated in the past 2 years. I booked the room online about 48 hours before my arrival. Breakfast was very good for business travel. I would stay here again and recommend to anyone looking for a nice quiet clean hotel off of I-84.
reviews.title: Unpleasant Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a triathlon in Middlebury. Room was big and comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Plenty of restaurants around. No problem parking. Breakfast was simple but there was plenty of it. They have a very small pool and fitness centre which I didn't get to use. Good value for money. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are regular Hampton Inn travelers and this was our first time at the Danbury location. We were thoroughly pleased with this hotel. It was convenient to I-84 while being quiet, accessable to nearby food and shopping, very clean, and modern. The AAA price was very reasonable. The breakfast was very good. We don't travel this way often but would stay here again if in the area.
reviews.title: Nice Hampton Stay

reviews.text: Just what you would expect from a Hampton's and more. Great indoor pool and fitness center. Very helpful and friendly staff. Very quiet and Clean. Great for business travel.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: For travelers on I-84, this hotel has easy on/off. It is located well back from any road and is very quiet. Lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance. Easy parking and excellent internet service. The staff was super...exceptionally helpful, pleasant, and accommodating. The breakfasts were good although the restaurant itself was not particularly attractive because it was small and near an outside door with people frequently going in an out. The fitness room is well equipped and convenient. I like a hard mattress, which my room did not have. An excellent choice. I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good for travelers on I-84

reviews.text: I am a loyal fan of the Hampton Inn chains. This one was very disappointing. The bathroom's exhaust fan was LITERALLY installed above the shower head! Not only did you have to look at this ugly thing while showering, but I was really afraid of it falling out and getting electricuted and even of hidden small cameras! (You never know these days.) My room had a rank smell, so I had to keep the air on high to mask it. The TV was the smallest of all the H.Inns I stayed at. The check-in clerk did not even smile when I arrived. The breakfast was on a lower (darkened) level. Breakfast was imitiation scrambled eggs, sauage, toast and waffles. (No starch items as in potations were offered.) The eggs tasted false. All-in-all, I would not stay at this particular H.I. again. (The elevator switches are so low, you practically have to kneel down to press them.)
reviews.title: I was disappointed in this one.
